com.biorecorder.edflib

Class HeaderConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biorecorder.edflib.base.EdfConfig
      • com.biorecorder.edflib.base.DefaultEdfConfig
        • com.biorecorder.edflib.HeaderConfig

  • public class HeaderConfig
extends DefaultEdfConfig
    This class permits to store the information required for the header record of EDF/BDF file and then correctly extract data from the file. It has the following fields (and their corresponding getters and setters):
    • patient identification
    • recording identification
    • recording recordingStartTime
    • number of data records
    • duration of a data record (in seconds)

    Also it permits to configure the measuring channels (signals) and has getters and setters for the fields describing every channel:

    • signal label
    • transducer type (e.g. AgAgCI electrode)
    • physical dimension(e.g. uV or degree C)
    • physical minimum (e.g. -500 or 34)
    • physical maximum (e.g. 500 or 40)
    • digital minimum (e.g. -2048)
    • digital maximum (e.g. 2047)
    • prefiltering (e.g. HP:0.1Hz LP:75Hz)
    • number of samples in each data record

    EDF/BDF format assumes a linear relationship between physical and digital values, and the scaling factors (gain and offset) for every channel are calculated on the base of its physical minimum and maximum and the corresponding digital minimum and maximum . So for every channel:

    (physValue - physMin) / (digValue - digMin) = constant [Gain] = (physMax - physMin) / (digMax - digMin)

    physValue = digValue * gain + offset
    digValue = (physValue - offset) / gain

    where:
    gain = (physMax - physMin) / (digMax - digMin)
    offset = (physMin - digMin * gain);

    In general "gain" refers to multiplication of a signal and "offset" refer to addition to a signal, i.e. out = in * gain + offset

    To get the number of the signals in data record use method DefaultEdfConfig.getNumberOfSignals()

    This class also contains helper methods to convert physical (floating point) values to digital (integer) ones and vice versa.

    Detailed information about EDF/BDF format: European Data Format. Full specification of EDF BioSemi or BDF file format

    BDF HEADER RECORD
    8 ascii : version of this data format (0)
    80 ascii : local patient identification (mind item 3 of the additional EDF+ specs)
    80 ascii : local recording identification (mind item 4 of the additional EDF+ specs)
    8 ascii : startdate of recording (dd.mm.yy) (mind item 2 of the additional EDF+ specs)
    8 ascii : starttime of recording (hh.mm.ss)
    8 ascii : number of bytes in header record (The header record contains 256 + (ns * 256) bytes)
    44 ascii : reserved
    8 ascii : number of data records (-1 if unknown, obey item 10 of the additional EDF+ specs)
    8 ascii : duration of a data record, in seconds
    4 ascii : number of signals (ns) in data record
    ns * 16 ascii : ns * label (e.g. EEG Fpz-Cz or Body temp) (mind item 9 of the additional EDF+ specs)
    ns * 80 ascii : ns * transducer type (e.g. AgAgCl electrode)
    ns * 8 ascii : ns * physical dimension (e.g. uV or degreeC)
    ns * 8 ascii : ns * physical minimum (e.g. -500 or 34)
    ns * 8 ascii : ns * physical maximum (e.g. 500 or 40)
    ns * 8 ascii : ns * digital minimum (e.g. -2048)
    ns * 8 ascii : ns * digital maximum (e.g. 2047)
    ns * 80 ascii : ns * prefiltering (e.g. HP:0.1Hz LP:75Hz)
    ns * 8 ascii : ns * nr of samples in each data record
    ns * 32 ascii : ns * reserved

        public HeaderConfig(FileType fileType)
        Default constructor that creates a HeaderConfig instance with 0 channels (signals). So all channels should be added as necessary.

        See method: DefaultEdfConfig.addSignal()

        Parameters:
        fileType - EDF_16BIT or BDF_24BIT

    • Method Detail

      • createFileHeader

        public byte[] createFileHeader()
                        throws EdfHeaderRuntimeException
        Creates byte array with the header info ready to write in Edf/Bdf file
        Returns:
        byte array with the header info
        Throws:
        EdfHeaderRuntimeException - if this HeaderConfig object is not correctly formed: Number of signals = 0, or number of samples in data record for some signal = 0.

      • getNumberOfBytesInHeaderRecord

        public int getNumberOfBytesInHeaderRecord()
        Get the number of bytes in the EDF/BDF header record (when we will create it on the base of this HeaderConfig)
        Returns:
        number of bytes in EDF/BDF header = (number of signals + 1) * 256

      • getFileType

        public FileType getFileType()
        Gets the type of the file: EDF_16BIT or BDF_24BIT
        Returns:
        type of the file: EDF_16BIT or BDF_24BIT

      • getNumberOfDataRecords

        public int getNumberOfDataRecords()
        Gets the number of DataRecords (data packages) in Edf/Bdf file. The default value = -1 and real number of DataRecords is set automatically when we finish to write data to the EdfWileWriter and close it
        Returns:
        number of DataRecords in the file or -1 if data writing is not finished

      • setNumberOfDataRecords

        public void setNumberOfDataRecords(int numberOfDataRecords)
        Sets the number of DataRecords (data packages) in Edf/Bdf file. The default value = -1 means that file writing is not finished yet. Normally EdfFileWriter calculate and sets the number of DataRecords automatically when we finish to write data to the EdfWileWriter and close it
        Parameters:
        numberOfDataRecords - number of DataRecords (data packages) in Edf/Bdf file

      • setDigitalRange

        public void setDigitalRange(int signalNumber,
                            int digitalMin,
                            int digitalMax)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the digital minimum and maximum values of the signal. Usually it's the extreme output of the ADC.
        -32768 <= digitalMin <= digitalMax <= 32767 (EDF_16BIT file format).
        -8388608 <= digitalMin <= digitalMax <= 8388607 (BDF_24BIT file format).

        Digital min and max must be set for every signal!!!
        Default digitalMin = -32768, digitalMax = 32767 (EDF_16BIT file format)
        Default digitalMin = -8388608, digitalMax = 8388607 (BDF_24BIT file format)

        Overrides:
        setDigitalRange in class DefaultEdfConfig
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal(channel). Numeration starts from 0
        digitalMin - the minimum digital value of the signal
        digitalMax - the maximum digital value of the signal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if digitalMin >= digitalMax,
        if 32767 <= digitalMin or digitalMin < -32768 (EDF_16BIT file format).
        if 32767 < digitalMax or digitalMax <= -32768 (EDF_16BIT file format).
        if 8388607 <= digitalMin or digitalMin < -8388608 (BDF_24BIT file format).
        if 8388607 < digitalMax or digitalMax <= -8388608 (BDF_24BIT file format).
